title: Sydney's Jewish community grapples with fear, grief after terror attack | ABC NEWS
description: Jewish Australians have faced increasing instances of antisemitism, and their worst fears were realised in the Bondi Beach terror attack at a Hanukkah festival. title: "Shock, heartbreak and despair": Imams condemn brutal Bondi Beach attack | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Australia's Muslim leaders have offered support and solidarity with local Jewish communities in the shadow of a deadly shooting attack that left 15 people dead at Bondi Beach. title: Tackling the 'enduring threat of extremist ideologies' | The World | ABC NEWS
description: A former US government counterterrorism official says the Bondi Beach attack is an example of "an enduring threat" of extremist ideologies in western countries. Javed Ali from the University of Michigan tells ABC News national security agencies would be thinking about "the potential for some type of copycat attacks" in the wake of the killings. #ABCTheWorld #ABCAsiaPacific  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Bondi Beach attack latest: Sydney pays tribute to victims, 27 remain in hospital | ABC NEWS
description: More than 1,000 people have attended a vigil on Bondi Beach for victims of a deadly attack on a Jewish festival at the site, as the Sydney Opera House was lit up with the Hanukkah Menorah symbol.  Meanwhile, 27 people remain in hospital, with six in a critical condition.  Ahmed al-Ahmed, who was shot while bravely confronting one of the shooters, received a visit from NSW Premier Chris Minns at St George Hospital in Sydney’s south. One of the two police officers who were injured in the terror attack has been identified as Constable Scott Dyson. title: Vigils for victims of the Bondi terror attack | ABC NEWS
description: Vigils are taking place around the world in memory of the victims of the Bondi Beach attack.   It follows Sydney Opera House being illuminated with a Hanukkah menorah and thousands gathering in the city on Monday to remember those killed 24 hours earlier. title: Huge surge in blood donations across Australia since Bondi Beach attack | ABC NEWS
description: The Red Cross has recorded huge volumes of people rolling up their sleeves at blood donation centres across Australia in the wake of the Bondi Beach terror attack.  Lifeblood reported 40,000 new blood donations since mass shooting, marking a 300 per cent increase on an ordinary day.  NSW Premier Chris Minns is urging more donors to come forth as a ‘practical’ way to make a difference. title: Hong Kong media mogul Jimmy Lai found guilty of sedition and collusion | ABC NEWS
description: Hong Kong media tycoon Jimmy Lai, one of the country’s harshest critics of China has been found guilty of sedition and collusion. title: Jewish leaders’ call to action after the Bondi massacre | ABC News Daily podcast
description: Sydney’s Jewish community is in shock after Sunday's mass shooting at Bondi Beach.   It was an act of terrorism that Jewish leaders long feared. So, in the depths of their sorrow, how are they coping and what are they asking for?   Today, Rabbi Mendel Kastel from support group Jewish House, whose brother in law Rabbi Eli Schlanger was killed in the attack.   Also, Liberal MP Julian Leeser, who is Jewish himself, on where Australians outraged at this attack should direct their anger.   Featured:    Rabbi Mendel Kastel   Julian Leeser, Liberal MP

title: Four killed in minivan crash in Muckatah in Victoria's north | ABC NEWS
description: Four people have been killed in a minivan crash near Cobram in Victoria’s north. Police say the driver of the van lost control of the vehicle and crashed into a tree. Five people, including three children have been airlifted to hospital with serious injuries. description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has hailed “real progress” towards peace during talks with US envoys in Berlin. title: Bondi Beach shooter was on ASIO's radar over Islamic State links | ABC NEWS
description: An ABC investigation has uncovered a Bondi Beach gunman’s links to the Islamic State and a notorious Sydney jihadist. Naveed Akram, who is currently under police guard in hospital, is understood to be a follower of pro-IS preacher Wisam Haddad. The gunman was active in preaching activities for Haddad's Dawah Van organisation. A former ASIO undercover agent alleges Naveed Akram was a worshipper at the controversial Al Madina Dawah prayer centre in Bankstown.
